column5: Roy drove down from Quebec yesterday for the fishing show and arrived at our place about 7:30 p.m. last night.  Great to see him again.  We invited Monique and TJ over aswell for some horses ovaries and a gab fest that went late into the night.  Great laughs all around and we even managed to watch a bit of the Olympic Opening Ceremonies          Headed down to the show this morning and ran into a gaggle of OFNCr's.  Took as many pics as I could.  Monique at Harrison's booth "Off The Docks"    Ran into Pete (Squid) at the main gathering area!!    Roy holding somebody else's beer for them    A crowd shot, from left to right, Albert (Hometownhandyman), Pete (Squid), Kelvin (loonietoon), TJ, Roy's sons, daughter-in-law and granddaugher, Carole (Bly) and Pete Maina.    Monique, Leah and Wayne (Irishfield), Pete Maina and Dan Bouck.    Wayne and I.    Crappiesteve    Dave Mercer, Roy and his boys    Dan Bouck, moi and Mercer    Roy's granddaughter, a budding OFC'r    Everyone dispursed and Paul, Roy and I headed to Kelsey's for some Ribs and wings, Dang!!  Paul and Roy are now sleeping off their heavy meal  Cheers all, was great to see you all again!!!  Here's my purchases:    Joey
I'm not gonna wash that hand for a week...   Great seeing you darling.. as well as everyone else that made the G2G and that we bumped into throughout the show.
looks like everyone had a great time

For anyone that didn't know where to go... Dave's pointing it out for them..     TJ, One of Roy's sons, Bly, Pete Maina, Dan and his wife ...    Joey, Monique and Leah. Corvette1 in the background in red (that drove the 2 hours from the USA to look at boats!) and TJ.    Dave Mercer... signing my Pete Maina Shirt !!! LOL    Pete Maina, Roy, TJ, Squid in the background.    Kelvin (loonietoon), JP DeRose, Bly    Leah having a good chat with Lawrence, the blind fisherman.  For those that don't know this courageous man.. http://www.blindfishingboat.com/
Great pics. Wish I could have been there but I was to busy catching nothing at the tournament in Barrie.
Good seeing you guys! It was nice to share some laughs and be away from the kiddies for a day.
great to meet other people from the site it was a good show every thing went great except for the 115 minute wait at the mandarin
Looks like a great time wish I was able to be there but we have a booth here in Chatham I think I just need to get a little closer to the Big smoke to make the GTG's
Good choice on the Jailbird Believer.
Thanks for the pics Hon. I might have one or two to add tonight when I get home.

It was great to meet and re-meet everyone there. Dave gave a great presentation as always, and I finially have a GPS for the new boat. Hirk was there dispensing advice and knowledge, heck, everyone was free with thier expertise. That is one of the defining things about this board. Thanks again everyone for a very nice time.

Great pics....looks like you guys had a super day at the show....I might have to consider driving down for that next year.  Joey...nice selection of lures   I bet you can hardly wait till the season comes now
Good Seeing everyone yesterday... Seen some old faces and met some new ones to  we were chatting away with Smalliefisher while the get-together was going on...
BTW my son loves his new shirt, thanks Phil and Maureen

I was there... but not really "socializing" hahaha... You can see my buddy's black hat in-between Pete Maina and the lady to the right of him. I was next to my buddy (Behind Pete Maina in the picture) *8th Picture*  I had no idea there was a G2G that day!  I was there... but not really.... Enjoyed seeing people that I recognized from the forum.
Great Pictures!!!  My report shortly.
He drove 2 hours to look at TJ?
There's something missing in all those pictures. Oh wait, I know, it's me....."DANG!"  Wish I could have been there, looks like I missed a great time.  But honestly $9.00 beers, that's criminal!

WHAT??????????????????????????....ya mean to tell me tht Roy was walking around with 2 beers in his hand valued at $20  .....  If that's what the show is charging visitors after they have already paid for parking, entry fee, then somone is doing some serious gouging ....UNREAL!!!
First off  no charge for parking, and its the international center that sells the booze not the show.  But I tell ya at the end of the day....  $9 wasn't so bad... lol
It was great to see everyone, Wish I could have stopped and chatted more.  My little guy max was scared of TJ (just kidding). He was impossible to keep away from the toys.  Got to love fishing show's
It was very nice to see the old gang and new faces mixed in. Thanks for the pics Joey!!
That's awesome Dan!!!!  Thanks for your support.  And thank you to all the other OFNers for their support and comments throughout the show!!!!
Looks like a fun day at the show, some funny pics too  Looking forward to seeing some of ya's this Saturday at Innisfil.  Tony
